intro: Godetia dasycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded godetia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, hairy fruits that contain several seeds. Godetia dasycarpa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
